description: Type of happy factorization of n.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..300
J. H. Conway, On Happy Factorizations, J. Integer Sequences, Vol. 1, 1998, #1.
Reinhard Zumkeller, Initial Happy Factorization Data for n <= 250
prog: (Haskell)a007968 = (\(hType,_,_,_,_) -> hType) . hh 0 = (0, 0, 0, 0, 0)h x = if a > 0 then (0, a, a, a, a) else h' 1 divs      where a = a037213 x            divs = a027750_row x            h' r []                                = h' (r + 1) divs            h' r (d:ds)             | d' > 1 && rest1 == 0 && ss == s ^ 2 = (1, d, d', r, s)             | rest2 == 0 && odd u && uu == u ^ 2  = (2, d, d', t, u)             | otherwise                           = h' r ds             where (ss, rest1) = divMod (d * r ^ 2 + 1) d'                   (uu, rest2) = divMod (d * t ^ 2 + 2) d'                   s = a000196 ss; u = a000196 uu; t = 2 * r - 1                   d' = div x dhs = map h [0..]hCouples = map (\(_, factor1, factor2, _, _) -> (factor1, factor2)) hssqrtPair n = genericIndex sqrtPairs (n - 1)sqrtPairs = map (\(_, _, _, sqrt1, sqrt2) -> (sqrt1, sqrt2)) hs-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 11 2015
author: _J. H. Conway_
